software.bernie.geckolib.animation.model

Class AnimatedTileEntityModel<T extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity & IAnimatedEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.client.renderer.model.Model
      • software.bernie.geckolib.animation.model.BaseAnimatedModel<T>
        • software.bernie.geckolib.animation.model.AnimatedTileEntityModel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type parameter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Consumer<net.minecraft.client.renderer.model.ModelRenderer>, net.minecraft.resources.IFutureReloadListener, net.minecraft.resources.IResourceManagerReloadListener

    public abstract class AnimatedTileEntityModel<T extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity & IAnimatedEntity>
extends BaseAnimatedModel<T>
implements net.minecraft.resources.IResourceManagerReloadListener
    An AnimatedEntityModel is the equivalent of an Entity Model, except it provides extra functionality for rendering animations from bedrock json animation files. The entity passed into the generic parameter needs to implement IAnimatedEntity.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.minecraft.resources.IFutureReloadListener

      • getAnimationFileLocation

        public abstract net.minecraft.util.ResourceLocation getAnimationFileLocation()
        This resource location needs to point to a json file of your animation file, i.e. "geckolib:animations/frog_animation.json"
        Returns:
        the animation file location
